items.title: Woodside Secures DOE Extension as Louisiana LNG Construction Advances
items.summary: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) has granted an export permit extension for Woodside Energy Group Ltd.’s Louisiana LNG, pushing its deadline for commencement of operations to the end of the decade.

items.title: ExxonMobil Eyeing More Natural Gas Growth, CCS Deals and Push for Data Centers
items.summary: Top ExxonMobil executives this month outlined a more expansive growth strategy through 2030, highlighting larger opportunities in natural gas, LNG and carbon capture while accelerating development in the Permian Basin.

items.title: Oversold Natural Gas Futures Find Support Ahead of Storage Report
items.summary: January natural gas futures extended a corrective rebound overnight as traders positioned ahead of an expected sizable storage withdrawal in U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) data due later today, reflecting frigid weather during the week

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Rebound Above $4 as Oversold Signals Ease Selling Pressure
items.summary: Nymex natural gas futures rebounded Wednesday, climbing back above $4.00/MMBtu as technicals and positioning ahead of an anticipated large storage withdrawal helped slow a weeklong sell-off.

items.title: European Gas Prices Find Footing as Winter Outlook Moderates
items.summary: The prompt Title Transfer Facility (TTF) could be reaching a floor as mild weather and abundant LNG supplies mix with Europe’s energy security requirements.

items.title: Market Bulls Probe the Upside as Natural Gas Futures Correct
items.summary: Participants bid up the price of natural gas Wednesday as the market was attempting to stabilize after sinking well below the $4.00/MMBtu mark.

items.title: Energy Execs See Brighter Outlook, Rising Natural Gas Prices Despite Uncertainty
items.summary: A cautious optimism is pervading the heart of the nation’s oil and natural gas sector as the year comes to a close, with executives expressing both uncertainty and improving sentiment over government policies and firming energy demand.

items.title: PNGTS Natural Gas Prices Whipsaw as Canada Imports, LNG Shore Up New England
items.summary: Cash prices along the Portland Natural Gas Transmission System (PNGTS) in New England tumbled by $9.200 to average $8.095/MMBtu on Tuesday with mild temperatures seen through the remainder of the week.

items.title: Maintenance, Natural Gas Price Volatility Underscore Lack of Alternative Flow Routes Near Canadian Border
items.summary: Natural gas prices near the border of western Canada are starting to retreat after popping earlier in the week amid a scheduled pipeline inspection along the Westcoast Energy LP T-South system.

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Trim Gains After EIA Posts Smaller-Than-Expected Storage Draw
items.summary: Natural gas futures pared early gains after the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) on Thursday reported a sizable but lighter-than-expected withdrawal of 167 Bcf from working storage for the week ended Dec. 12.

items.title: West Africa Oil Faces Crisis as Global Surplus Builds
items.summary: Millions of barrels of Nigerian and Angolan crude remain unsold in the December and January loading programs, as they struggle to compete with ample supply and cheaper cargoes, traders and analysts have told Reuters.  Nigeria alone had about 20 milli

items.title: Falklands Oil Megaproject Breaks Free After 15 Years
items.summary: After 15 years of delay, redesign, and skepticism, the Sea Lion oil project has finally crossed the line from ambition to execution. On December 10, partners Navitas Petroleum (Israel) and Rockhopper Exploration (UK) took a long-awaited final investm

items.title: Russia's Oil Exports Face Delays as Tankers Take 70% Longer Route
items.summary: Oil tankers carrying Russian oil appear to be avoiding the fastest Black Sea route to the Turkish straits and travel along the Georgian and Turkish coasts to avoid drone attacks from Ukraine, according to ship-tracking data compiled by Bloomberg.  In

items.title: Top Exporters Boosted Natural Gas Supply in October
items.summary: Norway ramped up its pipeline gas exports, Qatar raised its LNG supply, and the United States saw LNG exports hit a record high in October, just as demand in the northern hemisphere started to grow with the fall in temperatures.  Global gas demand ju

items.title: Global Oil Demand Surges Driven by Indian Market Rebound
items.summary: Global oil demand jumped in October from the previous month and from October last year amid a rebound in India’s product demand, the latest data by the Joint Organizations Data Initiative (JODI) showed on Thursday. Oil demand increased by 677,000 bar
